fr.sorbonne_u.cps.dht_mapreduce.interfaces.mapreduce

Interface ReductorI<A extends java.io.Serializable,R>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.BiFunction<A,R,A>, java.io.Serializable
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ReductorI<A extends java.io.Serializable,R>
extends java.util.function.BiFunction<A,R,A>, java.io.Serializable
    The functional interface ReductorI allows to define functions in the reduce part of the map/reduce protocol that reduce a result of type R from the map part with an accumulator of type A to produce a new accumulator of type A.

    Description

    In the reduce part of the map/reduce, data are progressively reduced i.e., a processing that takes a previous result of the reduction of type A extends Serializable and the result of type R of the mapped function on a piece of data and return an updated result of the reduction of type A extends Serializable. The reduction functions in this DHT/MapReduce project must implement ReductorI<A extends Serializable,R>, which is a specialisation of the Java functional interface BiFunction<A,R,A> that takes a parameter that is an accumulator of the results of the previous reduction, a result of the mapped function and returns an updated accumulator of the results of the reduction.

    The ReductorI<A extends Serializable,R> functional interface is itself serialisable as in a DHT, they have to be passed as parameters over the network.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2024-06-04

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
